questions.question_text: What is the maximum number of records to be printed in the Printable View of a list view?

choices.C: Only if the Object is not related to any other object

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Yes

Custom object reports become accessible when you create a custom object and add a custom object tab in Salesforce. Additionally, you must enable the “Allow Reports” checkbox in the custom object settings to include the object in the report builder. Once this is done, Salesforce automatically generates a report type for the custom object, which can then be used to create reports.

Selected Answer: A
In Salesforce, when you add a custom object tab, custom object reports become accessible. This is because the custom object tab allows you to display custom object data in Salesforce. However, please note that the visibility of these reports may depend on the user’s profile permissions.
A custom object tab purpose is to give a users access to custom object data and records in an app. Custom object tabs look and function just like standard tabs.
Can someone please confirm if this is the right answer.

comments.content: when creating a custom object you have to choose allow reports. In the question it only chose tabs

questions.question_text: Are custom object reports accessible when you add a custom object tab?
What is not found on a Company Profile?

discussion.content:
Company settings are a collection of global attributes to describe the organization using Salesforce. They consist of company, currency, fiscal year, support, and locale settings.

Profile define how users access objects and data, and what they can do within the application. When you create users, you assign a profile to each one.

I think B is the correct answer.
Please refer to the following link:
https://subscription.packtpub.com/book/big_data_and_business_intelligence/9781786468963/1/ch01lvl1sec9/establishing-your-company-profile-within-salesforce#:~:text=The%20company%20profile%20contains%20core,License%20information
